did.unittitle: Miniature painting with the necessary instructions, [ca. 1798]

physdesc.extent: 1 volume, 76 p., copied from a printed volume

did.abstract: This volume identifies miniatures as distinct from other paintings, and provides instructions on fixing canvas, mixing paints, and arranging subjects, painting draperies, and flowers.
did.physdesc: 1 volume, 14 p., copied from a printed volume.

odd.head: Administrative Note
odd.p: This record is superseded by, and included in, B P31. It was marked “internal only” in Dec., 2010 and is being kept in the case that it is needed for future administrative needs.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Acquired, 1945. See in-house shelf list for accession information and additional accession numbers.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies note
altformavail.p: This volume is also available on microfilm (Film 240, Reel 7).

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Titian Ramsay Peale was a student and painter, and was a son of Charles Willson Peale.
